intro: Erigeron congestus, commonly known as the clustered fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open areas such as meadows and prairies, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, and it produces numerous small white to pale blue flowers. Erigeron congestus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
